metadata.title: CVE-2019-3859 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the_libssh2_packet_require and _libssh2_packet_requirev functions. A remoteattacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a Denial ofService or read data in the client memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh2-1 - 1.4.3-2ubuntu0.2+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libssh2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3-2ubuntu0.2+esm2').
